metadata.title: CVE-2021-3177 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Python 3.x through 3.9.1 has a buffer overflow in PyCArg_repr in_ctypes/callproc.c, which may lead to remote code execution in certainPython applications that accept floating-point numbers as untrusted input,as demonstrated by a 1e300 argument to c_double.from_param. This occursbecause sprintf is used unsafely.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18
No subscription required

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13').
